ABOUT MAPPINGS

The Center has invested a lot of effort into a variety of mappings projects. The common thread running through these projects is ATT&CK; each project maps some external system into the ATT&CK knowledge base. Click on each mapping project to learn more and see the ATT&CK mappings.

MAPPINGS PROJECTS

NIST 800-53

The NIST 800-53 is a cybersecurity standard and compliance framework developed by the National Institute of Standards in Technology. It’s a continuously updated framework that tries to flexibly define standards, controls, and assessments based on risk, cost-effectiveness, and capabilities.

300 Mappings ATT&CK Versions 8.2, 9.0, 10.1

Learn More

VERIS

The Vocabulary for Event Recording and Incident Sharing (VERIS) is a set of metrics designed to provide a common language for describing security incidents in a structured and repeatable manner. VERIS targets this problem by helping organizations to collect useful incident-related information and to share that information - anonymously and responsibly - with others.

300 Mappings ATT&CK Versions 9.0, 12.1

Learn More

CVE

CVE, short for Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures, is a list of publicly disclosed computer security flaws. When someone refers to a CVE, they mean a security flaw that's been assigned a CVE ID number. CVEs help IT professionals coordinate their efforts to prioritize and address these vulnerabilities to make computer systems more secure.

300 Mappings ATT&CK Versions 9.0

Learn More

Amazon Web Services

The NIST 800-53 is a cybersecurity standard and compliance framework developed by the National Institute of Standards in Technology. It’s a continuously updated framework that tries to flexibly define standards, controls, and assessments based on risk, cost-effectiveness, and capabilities.

300 Mappings ATT&CK Versions 8.2, 9.0, 10.1

Learn More

Azure

The Vocabulary for Event Recording and Incident Sharing (VERIS) is a set of metrics designed to provide a common language for describing security incidents in a structured and repeatable manner. VERIS targets this problem by helping organizations to collect useful incident-related information and to share that information - anonymously and responsibly - with others.

300 Mappings ATT&CK Versions 9.0, 12.1

Learn More

Google Cloud Platform

CVE, short for Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures, is a list of publicly disclosed computer security flaws. When someone refers to a CVE, they mean a security flaw that's been assigned a CVE ID number. CVEs help IT professionals coordinate their efforts to prioritize and address these vulnerabilities to make computer systems more secure.
